sub_title: Senior Researcher/Policy Advisor at Energy Transition Unit, TNO
summary: Experienced Senior Researcher/Policy Advisor with a demonstrated history of working to develop knowledge and better policies in the field of sustainable energy. Skilled in Sustainable Development, Climate Change, Policy Analysis, Sustainability, and Renewable Energy. Graduated from the University of Oslo.

education.field_of_study: PhD course (participation only): Energy Management and Policy, and Energy-Economy Policy Modeling

projects.title: CertifHy
projects.description: The CertifHy Project Consortium aims to develop the first EU-wide framework for the generation of guarantees of origin (GoO) for green hydrogen. The project coordinated by Hinicio, brings along the Energy Research Centre of the Netherlands (ECN), Ludwig Bölkow Systemtechnik (DE) and TÜV SÜD, supported by a wide range of key European industry leaders (gas companies, energy utilities, green hydrogen technology developers and automobile manufacturers, as well as leading industry associations). The project started late 2014 and will culminate end 2016 after 24 months of joint work.

contributors.headline: Senior Researcher/Policy Advisor at Energy Transition Unit, TNO
Substantive Director at NVDE, the Netherlands Association for Renewable Energy, also affiliated to Utrecht University
PhD candidate at the University of Miami
Head of Global Business Development & Marketing

projects.title: BETTER (Bringing Europe and Third countries closer together through renewable Energies)
projects.description: EU-funded BETTER project addressed cooperation on renewable energy between the EU and third countries (Western Balkans, North Africa and Turkey)  in several dimensions. The starting point was given through the cooperation mechanisms provided by the 2009 EU RES Directive (2009/28/EU), allowing Member States to achieve their 2020 RES targets in a more cost efficient way, and thereby including the possibility to cooperate with third countries,

contributors.headline: Senior Researcher/Policy Advisor at Energy Transition Unit, TNO

projects.title: NorthSeaGrid
projects.description: EU-funded NorthSeaGrid project on the implementation of a NorthSea offshore grid, focused on delivering solutions to practical financial and regulatory barriers to the development and construction of hybrid offshore projects, i.e. grid interconnectors and offshore wind parks, as outlined in three concrete case studies

contributors.headline: Senior Researcher/Policy Advisor at Energy Transition Unit, TNO

projects.title: MitigationMomentum I
projects.description: Mitigation Momentum I project aimed to support the development of Nationally Appropriate Mitigation Actions (NAMAs) by contributing to the concrete development of NAMA proposals, and foster cooperation and knowledge exchange within the NAMA community. Overall objectives included: advancing NAMA development in selected  countries (including Kenya), contributing to knowledge on NAMA development and best practice, increasing knowledge sharing and cooperation among the NAMA community, advancing the international climate policy debate on mitigation.

contributors.headline: Senior Researcher/Policy Advisor at Energy Transition Unit, TNO

projects.title: Seanergy2020
projects.description: EU-funded SEANERGY2020 project provided an in-depth analysis of the national and international Maritime Spatial Planning (MSP) practices, policy recommendations for developing existing and potentially new MSP for the development of offshore renewable power generation, and promoted acceptance of the results.

contributors.headline: Senior Researcher/Policy Advisor at Energy Transition Unit, TNO

projects.title: SUSPLAN (Development of regional and Pan-European guidelines for more efficient integration of renewable energy into future infrastructures)
projects.description: EU-funded SUSPLAN project developed strategies, recommendations, criteria and benchmarks for an efficient integration of renewable energies into the future infrastructure in the period 2030 to 2050, targeting decision makers from the political arena and the power industry, and particularly those active in the field of infrastructure and networks (e.g. electricity, heat, cooling energy, (bio)gas, hydrogen, storage) both in EU-Member States and across Europe as a whole.

contributors.headline: Senior Researcher/Policy Advisor at Energy Transition Unit, TNO

projects.title: WINDSPEED
projects.description: WINDSPEED developed a roadmap for offshore wind energy deployment in the Central and Southern North Sea (Belgium, Denmark, Germany, the Netherlands, Norway and the UK) to 2030, addressing costs and potentials, grid integration, competing uses of the sea and other barriers challenges. A GIS-based decision tool was developed for identifying deployment potentials under different scenarios and constraints.

projects.title: Mainstreaming RES
projects.description: Project objective is to assist the Commission in preparing the impact assessment and the proposal for the new EU legislative framework on renewable energy due in 2017, which should mainstream deployment of renewable energy and ensure that the EU meets its 2030 renewable energy target. Specifically, the project will develop and assess mechanisms to assure that the EU meets its at least 27% target of renewable energy; develop and analyse EU-wide policies to incentivise renewable energy deployment and mainstream renewable energy in general (no-reget options); enable the Commission to start a discussion of Member State levels of flexibility in their energy systems, which may be translated into indicators, in order for a cost efficient operation of the internal energy market; and to equipt  the Commission with deployment scenarios for on-shore, off-shore and PV power, coherent with a renewable electricity share in Europe of 45% to 60% by 2030, and consulted with stakeholders and Member States.

company.name: ECN (Energy research Centre of the Netherlands)

profile_positions.description: Project acquisition and project management, mainly EU projects with a focus on renewable energy.   Providing policy research and analysis on issues related to renewable energy and green growth, translating results into policy recommendations. Preparing reports and policy briefs. Actively engaging with stakeholders (organising workshops and stakeholder consultations) across the whole energy sector, including consumers, utilities, project developers, banks and investors as well as regulators and government officials. Networking with academia and research institutes, consultants, renewable energy associations, and industry to develop and acquire adequate funding for new projects focusing on improved policy framework for renewable energy.
profile_positions.title: Senior Researcher/Policy Advisor

company.name: European Commission, DG TREN (now DG ENER)

profile_positions.company: European Commission, DG TREN (now DG ENER)
profile_positions.description: Development and monitoring of policies and measures to promote renewable energy in the European Union. Providing support on liaising EU policy on renewable energy with other EU policies, such as environmental, biodiversity, R&D, and maritime policies.
profile_positions.title: Seconded national expert

profile_positions.description: Assessing models for regulation of Norwegian grid operators with a view to establishing a revised regulatory regime from 2007. Administering the economic regulation of the Norwegian transmission system operator (STATNETT) and the incentive-based economic regulation of grid operators, aimed at promoting a cost-efficient quality of electricity supply.
profile_positions.title: Advisor

company.name: Norwegian Ministry of Petroleum and Energy

profile_positions.company: Norwegian Ministry of Petroleum and Energy
profile_positions.description:
2003 - 2000: Analysis and development of policies and measures to promote renewable energy, including assessment of Norwegian implementation of the EU Renewable Electricity Directive (EC/2001/77), and a mandatory green certificate scheme as a possible means of promoting renewable electricity. Managing studies  on the implementation of a mandatory green certificate scheme for renewable electricity and heating in Norway. Liaising renewable energy policy with environmental policy. Assessing possible ways to incorporate renewable energy into local and regional planning systems in Norway. Contributing to briefings and speeches, and answers to parliamentary questions concerning renewable energy.

1997 - 1999: Analysis and development of policies and measures to promote energy efficiency in Norway. Tasks related to the Nordic Energy Cooperation, including the development of a strategy for increased energy cooperation in the Baltic Sea area and preparing the Nordic Energy Ministerial meeting in Trondheim, Norway in 1999. Representing the Ministry in various international working groups, such as the IEA Working Group on Energy Efficiency and UNECE Working Party on Energy Efficiency. Preparing briefings and speeches, and answers to parliamentary questions on energy efficiency.
profile_positions.title: Advisor

company.name: Norwegian Ministry of Agriculture and Food

profile_positions.company: Norwegian Ministry of Agriculture and Food
profile_positions.description: Coordinating the Ministry’s responsibilities to ensure that the County Governor performed its statutory duties with regard to the implementation of agricultural policy and measures at regional and local level.
profile_positions.title: Senior Executive Officer
